entry.title: Accruals & Deductions for Casual/Hourly Workers
entry.content:
Hello SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking Experts,

Is there any standard solution in SF to cover the accruals and deductions for casual/daily workers (especially in Retail sector across different countries).

Scenario : 

1. They do not have a fixed work schedule. So normally with 0 working hours across all days.  ---- So work schedule with all days as non-working days to be configured in SF.

2. Based on the time recorded in the time tracking, system to calculate the accruals for those employees. (So if worked 5 days 4 hours each in the last month, gets pro-rated accruals accordingly in days/hours based on business requirement). ---- Standard behavior with accrual logic based on Recorded Times.

3. But how can the deductions be handled when employee is applying for a vacation?

-- If accruals are in days,  and when employee applies for a leave for 15.10.2025, system will deduct 0 days as no planned working hours on that day, or 1 day if deduction is based on calendar days. But both are wrong, as normally the business requirement is to average out the no. of hours worked in the last 12 months and accordingly calculate the deduction quantity. (However it is not possible via the counting configuration to determine the average hours worked based on timesheet).

-- -- If accruals are in hours,  and when employee applies for a leave for 15.10.2025, system will not allow to put leave in hours as only full day absences are allowed for non-working days. And if a full day absence is applied, how will system know how many hours to deduct? Same problem with counting rule above.   In this case, only thing i can think of is to have another custom field asking employee to put the no.of hours he wants to request, and then use that in the counting rule as deduction.

Is there any standard way or any recommendations of handling this in SF?

@NeeleshKamath  @Volker_Ruof @PriyankaAgarwal 

Regards,

Mohit Somani

entry.title: How to Add a New Tab in ESS Portal for Time Event (Punch In/Out)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I am working on Employee Self-Service (ESS) in SAP Portal and I want to add a new tab in the ESS overview for Time Event, where employees can view and record Punch In / Punch Out times.

Here’s what I have done so far:

  1. Created a Web Dynpro ABAP Component (Z_HRESS_TIME_EVENT) with:

    • From Date / To Date input

    • Punch In / Punch Out buttons

    • Table showing history of time events

  2. Exposed it as a Web Dynpro Application (Z_HRESS_TIME_EVENT_APP) in SE80, which runs perfectly when tested directly.

  3. In LPD_CUST, I created a new folder under the same Role / Instance as other tabs (Working Time, Personal Information, Benefits) and added my application there.

Problem / Question:

When I log in to the ESS Portal, I do not see my new tab. I understand that the Portal shows tabs via iViews and role assignments.

I want to know:

  • How can I create an iView for my Web Dynpro application and assign it to the ESS Role / Workset in the Portal?

  • Can this be done without Portal Admin access, or do I need someone with admin rights?

  • Are there best practices for adding Time Event tabs in ESS overview for punch in/out functionality?

Any guidance, example steps, or references would be very helpful!

Thanks in advance.

#SAP #ABAP #WebDynpro #ESS #SAPPortal #EmployeeSelfService #LPD_CUST #FPM

Upgrade DMIS on LTRS 1.0 for S/4 PERSON_NAME from DMIS DIGITS SP05 to DMIS 2020SP10

entry.title: Re: Compatibility for DMIS 2020 SP10
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

 

Yes, the scenario is supported. 

Since DMIS 2020 SP10 is equivalent to DMIS 2018 SP14, it is possible to check note below:

3657956 - Release Information SLT - DMIS 2018 SP14

 

Best Regards, 

SAP Support.

entry.title: Third Time's a Charm: SAP Customer Engagement Initiative 2025 Cycle 3 Now Live!
entry.content:
All good things come in threes, and we’re excited to share that the third cycle of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative for 2025 is now live! This cycle features 47 new projects, offering SAP customers and partners the opportunity to gain early insights into product developments and actively collaborate with SAP teams to shape the future of SAP solutions.

🗓Registration is open until November 14, 2025

In a rapidly evolving business landscape, being at the forefront of discussions can make a tangible impact. The SAP Customer Engagement Initiative gives you the chance to work directly with SAP product managers and developers, sharing your feedback on ideas, prototypes, and plans while they’re still in the initial phases.

To help you explore the available projects, we’ve compiled a detailed list for your convenience. Check out the full list here or follow the links below to discover the exciting opportunities:

SAP Ariba

  • Asset Administration Shell (AAS) with SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration

SAP Business Technology Platform

  • Adoption of the SAP Job Scheduling service and it's new capabilities
  • AI-assisted message monitoring agent for SAP Integration Suite
  • Attachment handling made easy with SAP Document Management service CAP Plugin
  • CAP Apps and SAP BTP Kyma Runtime Environment
  • Effortlessly manage you documents using SAP Document Management service mobile application
  • Improving the Admin's and Solution Architect's Experience on SAP BTP
  • SAP Discovery Center: Long-Term User Research Initiative
  • Shape the future of job orchestration capabilities in SAP Build Process Automation
  • The impact of AI on SAP BTP users

SAP Concur

  • Concur Travel Allowance: Share Your Experiences
  • Discovery for App Center Enhancement

Customer Experience

  • Agentic Innovation in SAP Sales Cloud
  • CX Intelligent Application

Data & Analytics

  • AI- Assisted Summaries in SAP Analytics Cloud Stories
  • Personalized KPI Monitoring Workflow
  • SAP HANA Database Migration to SAP HANA Cloud (XSC,XSA,CAP)

SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Finance & Risk

  • Risk Management Lifecycle for SAP Risk and Assurance Management

Digital Supply Chain Cloud

  • Identify un-assessed assets and auto propose draft risk assessments using AI Agent
  • SAP Digital Battery Passport
  • SAP Field Service Management - Improvements for Maintenance Planning

Private Cloud

  • Compatible Unit Transformation: Modernizing Compatible Unit Management
  • SAP Responsibility Management in ERP Private Cloud and On-Premise
  • Supply and Demand Segmentation: improvements of functionality and integration

Public Cloud

  • A Modern Treasury Experience: New Fiori App for Interest Rate Instrument
  • AI Agent for Accrual Postings SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • AI Agent for Debt Collection
  • AI Assistant for Manual Postings in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Business AI for Product Cost Controlling
  • Joule as Project Assistant: Optimizing Project Execution and Reducing Manual Processes
  • Let’s Create the Future of US Sales and Use Tax with AI
  • Line Item Settlement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Manage Statistical Key Figure Values: Potential Enhancements
  • Modernizing Inventory valuation - Lower of Cost or Net Realizable Value
  • Parallel Unit of Measure
  • Review Booklets and MDA: the next level of SAP S/4HANA Reporting and Analytics
  • SAP Responsibility Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP Risk and Assurance Management - Enhance the Task Management user experience
  • SAP Risk and Assurance Management - Exploring Joule use cases and AI features
  • User Interface Masking for Process Industries in SAP Cloud ERP
  • SAP Fiori Elements for Mobile

SAP Globalization

  • Regulatory Change Manager: Solution to help navigate Regulatory Changes with ease
  • Reimagine VAT Reporting Solution for Ukraine Based on SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

Lifecycle Management

  • Automation and AI in Private Cloud Workspace
  • Clean Core / RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard in SAP Cloud ALM
  • Explore modifiable transport requests on SAP BTP

Other

  • SAP S/4HANA for Fashion and Vertical Business: Supply Chain Collaboration

Let’s shape the future together!

Innovation happens through collaboration. By participating in the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects, you help SAP create better, more relevant solutions for businesses like yours. This is your chance to influence what comes next.

Don’t miss out – sign up today at influence.sap.com and be a part of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 3 in 2025!

Warm regards, 
Your SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Team 

Follow-up after registration: When you register for a project, you will be invited to an introductory call with the SAP project lead. At this point further participation is optional. Typically, all activities are governed by the Feedback Agreement with SAP.

entry.title: SAP Fiori Tools - Errors while creating Fiori Apps
entry.content:
Hi, been working with extensions with Application Wizard, and SAP Fiori Tools for almost two years, since yesterday and last updates from these extensions and libraries, for I can tell it's the first time I have these kind of problems in creating apps, but not currently having problems in running, testing, or uploading apps. As you can see I've been trying to remove, installing libraries, cache, or even extension files from VSCode. I cannot assume it can be an update thing, a coworker show me with a full installation of extensions (after months he uninstalling them), he can create Fiori apps without any trouble. The errors or warnings I'd had before was:

@SAP/fiori:app generator failed - env.on(error) You don't seem to have a generator with the name “@sap/fiori:fiori-freestyle” installed.

Does someone knows how can I manage these situation?

Have a nice day, greetings!

entry.title: Re: 🟢 What's new in RAP
entry.content:
What info message are you referring to? Can you please specify the interface / method name you are referring to?
The execute() method does not return anything.
When you add a step in a queue or when you save your stuff to execution you can retrieve a string that allows you to monitor the process

 DATA(process_monitor) = cl_bgmc_process_factory=>get_for_queue(
                                    iv_bg_processing_context = 'ZDMO_BGPF_CONTEXT_04'
                                    iv_queue                 = 'TEST_QUEUE_0424'
                                )->create(
                                )->set_name( |Calculate order data { i_rap_bo_key }|
                                )->set_operation_tx_uncontrolled( NEW zdmo_cl_start_bgpf_queued_04(
                                                                          i_wait_time  = i_wait_time
                                                                          i_rap_bo_key = i_rap_bo_key )
                                )->save_for_execution( ).

        r_process_monitor_string = process_monitor->to_string( ).

entry.title: Re: Selecting service plan for SAP Ariba Central invoice...
entry.content:
Good day @MeghaIngulkar @Robert-Jan 

Not sure if you both work in the same organisation. I will be basing my answer on @Robert-Jan's comment.

Thank you for your clarification.

Since your invoices will come through Peppol à DRC à CIM à public cloud, you must use the CIM service plan inbound-drc in your BTP subaccount.

The scim plan is only for standard Ariba Network or manual invoice integrations.

Additionally, for you to enable Peppol integration and inbound eDocument handling, you will need the SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management, inbound Processing Module license.

You can consult blog: Integration SAP DRC (cloud edition) with SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management and the recommended reference for Setting Up Connectivity.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: how payment terms and payment methods should be confi...
entry.content:
Hello,

To create new payment method, access the app Manage Your Solution and use the following SSCUIs :
 SSCUI 101972 - Set Up Payment Methods for Each Country/Region for Payment Transactions
 SSCUI  101044 - Set Up Payment Methods per Company Code for Payment Transactions
Assign the created payment method to a bank using
SSCUI 101045 - Set Up Bank Determination for Payment Transactions
In the posting details you can specify whether it is a vendor payment or customer payment by choosing the "Document Type for Payment".

You can refer the help documentation on Configuring Payment Methods

Best Regards,

Annapurna

entry.title: HCM Brasil – Crédito do Trabalhador - Erro de líquido insuficiente com rubricas de pensão
entry.content:
Olá pessoal, 
 
Após a implementação da solução do Crédito do Trabalhador – eConsignado, a seguinte mensagem pode aparecer no log de execução da folha de pagamento: 

Erro com uma rubrica salarial de penhora. 
Deveria deduzir-se uma rubrica salarial de penhora na tabela RT, mas o montante líquido restante não era suficientemente grande. 
Causa possível: codificação incorreta da rubrica salarial na visão V_T51P6. 
 
Este cenário pode ocorrer para quem possuir rubricas de Pensão na visão Caracts.deduções dias em atraso, visão global (V_T51P6), somente para serem desconsideradas da Remuneração Disponível do empregado. 
 
A SAP Note 3648439 - PRPRI - Garnishment wage type error after customizing T51P6 foi disponibilizada para evitar que a mensagem seja exibida. Caso este seja seu cenário, é necessário implementar a SAP Note mencionada e remover as rubricas de Pensão da visão de tabela V_T51P6.
 
Gostou desse post? Dê um Like e compartilhe o conteúdo com seus colegas. 
 
Fiquem à vontade para deixar um feedback, comentário ou pergunta sobre este Blog post no espaço abaixo.

E não esqueçam de seguir a tag HCM Payroll Brazil na SAP Community para ficarem ligados nas últimas notícias.  

Um abraço, 

Juliano Klein

entry.title: Re: Posting of Recognized Revenue for Cost‑Based Percenta...
entry.content:
Hello @summy

Please note that the most common causes of Recognised Revenue remaining at 0 JPY while Recognised COS posts correctly under the EPMFC key are:

  • Your planned revenue is not linked to the same WBS/billing element where the recognition key is assigned.
  • Your planned data is maintained in a different ledger or planning category,
  • Your revenue account mapping is missing in the Assign G/L Accounts for Revenue Recognition configuration step or,
  • Your project was not revaluated after changes to your plan data. Ensure you rerun Revaluation in the app.

I advice to carry out those steps and that should display the expected 10,000,000 JPY recognised revenue.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud compass Support of Seamless Planning & Live Version
entry.content:
One of the most often feedback received since SAP Analytics Cloud compass' general release is the ability to simulate with data from SAP Datasphere. With the coming Q4 2025 release, this will become reality.

The benefits are obvious: The support of seamless planning setup including live version connections will mean that users can do away with data redundancy and streamline data management workflow with the confidence that the compass simulations performed are always based on a single source of truth, the latest data, even if it is residing in SAP Datasphere, at any point in time. And as we all know: When it comes to simulations, this level of confidence is pivotal for the usefulness of the insights generated. 

To learn more about seamless planning and the setting up of a live version connection, I highly recommend checking out @Max_Gander's blog post with use cases, benefits and FAQ: Unlocking the Next Chapter of Seamless Planning in SAP Business Data Cloud with Live Versions. Once that is all set up, compass users will be able to perform Monte Carlo Simulation directly on the live version. Below you can see an example of creating a simulation with the version "Plan00", a live version. You can see there is basically no difference between the handling of scenarios based on a live or native version, and there is free choice to base your scenarios on any of the available versions.




An important detail here: Users will also be notified upon data changes in live versions. In the below example you can see that a change is made to the original data, a CSV file, which is then uploaded into the local table in SAP Datasphere, upon which the view for the live version is generated. When this change is deployed, compass will be able to detect the difference in baseline value and reflect the change in the driver list. 

With the support for seamless planning AND live version connection, compass is enabling more flexibility in setup and shortening the time-to-insight to a greater extent than before.

entry.title: Re: Ship to party
entry.content:
I have resolved the issue after so many hit & try.

The Solution

After a long trial period and several failed attempts, I finally found a sequence that worked perfectly.

Here’s the approach that successfully created the desired Sold-To and Ship-To mapping:

Step-by-Step Process

  1. Upload the Ship-To Parties Completely
    • Use the Customer Master migration template to upload all Ship-To customers first.
    • Ensure they contain all relevant General Data and Sales Data so they exist fully in the system.
  2. Upload the Sold-To Party
    • Create only the General Data for your Sold-To customers (do not include sales data at this point).
    • This ensures the system recognizes the Sold-To customer as existing but not yet extended to the sales and distribution role.
  3. Use the Extend Template – Customer: Extend Existing Record by New Org Level
    • In this template, now extend the Sold-To Party by adding its Sales Data.
    • In the Partner Function tab, maintain the Ship-To Parties you uploaded earlier.
    • Make sure all mapping is done using system-generated BP numbers, not legacy numbers.

By following this sequence, the system accepts the records successfully — even for the same sales area — and links all Ship-To Parties to their respective Sold-To Party automatically.

️ Example Screenshots

General Data Tab

 

Sales data tab

 

Partner Function Tab

Regards,

Tehreem Fatima

entry.title: Re: Automatic creation of PR for components when producti...
entry.content:
No, in standard, requisitions for externally procured stock components (item category “L”, procurement type “F”) linked to a sales order (special stock “E”) are not created automatically at production order creation — they require MRP to be run.

Why MRP is required because, in your Make-to-Order (MTO) setup, the production order creates reservations for BOM components. These reservations are for special stock “E” (sales order stock). SAP standard logic does not trigger PR creation directly from reservations — it relies on MRP to evaluate the reservations and generate the corresponding purchase requisitions. This behavior is by design to allow MRP to consider:

  • Component availability
  • Lead times
  • Lot sizing
  • Procurement strategies

entry.title: Re: Mastering Total ETag in RAP , A Practical Guide.
entry.content:
It's an interesting subject but for cripes sake, could you please ask ChatGPT to proofread this and update the text? Sorry but it's just incomprehensible as written, I gave up reading. "abap", "Odata" and 5 different variations of spelling ETag are not helping either.

It's one of the rare cases when documentation explains it simply and accurately, I think: "The total ETag is a designated field in a draft business object to enable optimistic concurrency checks during the transition from draft to active data."

entry.title: How to find specific rights for User Security using Query Builder?
entry.content:
I am attempting to build a utility that can assign the desired security across the SAP environment. Currently I am testing setting the user security for a User Group on a Universe and have set some of the rights, but one in particular is not working. So I am wondering what object is storing those rights so I can try to identify what went wrong and ig I maybe have an incorrect ID.

This was an old utility I am attempting to update.

GetUniverse() successfully queries to get the targeted universe and the rights are all being set as expected except UniverseDataAccessRight. I don't know what the IDs that are assigned to the consts represent, but using them as a SI_ID did not find anything on CI_SYSTEMOBJECTS, CI_APPOBJECTS, or CI_INFOOBJECTS . If someone could tell me where the rights exist I could probably work out why its not assigning like the others

 

EDIT: Actually I was wrong about UniverseCreateEditQueryRight applying correctly. It is using an inherited right, not the one being set by the code. So neither are being set as intended. So still need to know what I need to access.

 

private const int UniverseDataAccessRight = 17367047;
private const int UniverseDataConnectionAccessRight = 19857415;
private const int UniverseCreateEditQueryRight = 17367048;

private string UpdateUniverseSecurity(string universeName, out string universeCuid)
{
string actionText = string.Empty;

InfoObjects universes = GetUniverse(universeName, ref actionText);


if (universes.Count == 1)
{
universeCuid = universes[1].CUID;
actionText += $"Setting security on universe \"{universeName}\".";

var advisorUserGroupPrincipal = universes[1].SecurityInfo.ObjectPrincipals.Add(AdvisorUsersGroup.ID);
advisorUserGroupPrincipal.Rights.AddSystemRight((int)CeSystemRights.ceRightView).Granted = true;
advisorUserGroupPrincipal.Rights.Add(UniverseDataAccessRight).Granted = true;
advisorUserGroupPrincipal.Rights.Add(UniverseCreateEditQueryRight).Granted = true;
universes[1].SecurityInfo.ObjectPrincipals.Add(EveryoneGroup.ID).Role = CeRole.ceRoleNoAccess;
IStore.Commit(universes);
}
else
universeCuid = string.Empty;

return actionText;
}

entry.title: DRTM Master Data Purge error: "There is no country specified for this user or user's country..."
entry.content:
The DRTM Master Data Purge requires prerequisites and configuration for a user to be successfully purged.

After you proceed with a DRTM Master Data Purge when you go to see the result, sometimes you see that the Purge is completed but you have the error "There is no country specified for this user or user's country is not DRM enabled.", meaning that the user was not purged and there is some misconfiguration.

And then you are wondering: what specifically is causing this error? How to verify this and correct for the Purge to be completed successfully? Is the Country missing? Is the Company Exit Date / Termination date missing? How to self-check and fix this for the Purge to be completed successfully?

Thinking about you and this scenario, we have developed the Troubleshooting DRTM Master Data Purge error: There is no country specified for this user or user's ... Guided Answers.

These Guided Answers were created with a step-by-step instructions and self-service troubleshooting to help you navigate the process and resolve the error on your own. These Guided Answers were inspired and created based on the methods that Product Support Team troubleshoot issues related to this error.

We hope you use it and your feedback is welcome for us to improve these Guided Answers further.

entry.title: Closing the Value Gap: Maximizing Share of Wallet and Reducing Contract Leakage
entry.content:
Share of wallet  

Share of wallet is the dollar amount a customer devotes to a particular supplier in a product category.  Suppliers try to maximize an existing customer's share of wallet by introducing multiple products and services to generate as much revenue as possible from each customer. A marketing campaign, for example, may have a stated goal of increasing the supplier’s wallet share for specific customers at the expense of its competitors. 

Benefits from increasing a customer’s share of wallet include added revenue, improved client retention, customer satisfaction and brand loyalty. 

Share of Wallet vs. Market Share 

Increasing wallet share can be a less expensive, more efficient, and therefore a more profitable strategy for suppliers to boost revenue rather than attempting to expand overall market share. It's important to note that wallet share and market share are two different concepts. Both market share and wallet share focus on growing revenue from customers. However, the growing market share focuses on attracting new clients from the competition. On the other hand, share of wallet focuses on growing revenue from existing clients by expanding the number of products being used–which might also be taken from the competition. 

Contract Value 

Contract value is the monetary value of a contract. It can range anywhere from a few hundred to millions of dollars. All of this depends on the work that is carried out or the products that are requested. Contract value also depends on the size of the customer that issues the initial proposal. A bid from an SME can be expected to have a lower contract value than a bid issued by a large enterprise trading on the SAP Business Network 

Contract Leakage 

Suppliers loose hundreds of thousands to millions of dollars through what is called contract leakage — the difference between the expected contract value and the real value created in production. That difference can be enormous. According to the International Association for Contract & Commercial Management (IACCM), poor contract management costs companies up to 9% of their revenue.   

Depending on the supplier’s industry, customers may not commit to a specific contract value or annual turnover. When this occurs, suppliers focus on educating buyers about their actual spend and encouraging them to channel more spend through their e-procurement channels. Suppliers may offer incentives for reaching certain volume thresholds such and reduced handling charges.  

Problems 

Contract leakage is a problem for both buyers and suppliers including the following issues:

Suppliers  

  • Lost Opportunities/Revenue: Suppliers fail to capitalize on opportunities for existing work, additional work, extensions, or renewals.  
  • Cost Overruns: Poor return on investment in such areas as catalogue integration, transactional integration, marketing, promotions, unnecessary or obsolete inventory  

Buyers 

  • Cost Overruns: If leakage exceeds contracted value, the buyer may be ineligibles for negotiated price discounts or rebates. 
  • Missed goals: The buyer’s goals to consolidate spend, reduce supplier base, address compliance and process needs not met. 
  • Cost Overruns: Poor return on investment in such areas as catalogue integration, transactional integration, sourcing effort, contracting effort…. 

Buyers and suppliers 

  • Relationship Strain: Leakage can result in contractual disputes and strain relationships between parties, affecting collaboration, and potentially leading to contract/relationship terminations and increased costs. 

Typical Causes 

Contract leakage may be the result of any of the following root causes:

  • Lack of visibility: Lack of visibility into all spend data, making it difficult to track and manage all transactions.  Buyers may not understand the full range of a supplier’s capabilities. 
  • Lack of commitment: Buyers not committing to a contract value or annual turnover can lead to untracked spend and leakage. 
  • Ineffective Rollout Plans: Poorly executed rollout plans can lead to low adoption and confidence issues among users. 
  • Data Quality Issues: Inadequate or incomplete data in catalogs can affect search results and product visibility, leading to leakage. 
  • Lack of Enforcement: Buyers not enforcing the adoption of new systems or allowing multiple supplier choices can result in continued use of previous vendors.  Customers using multiple purchasing channels, such as direct websites, instead of a single integrated platform. Users deviating from the established procurement process and preferred suppliers.   
  • System Integration Problems: Technical issues during system integration can cause disruptions and affect order processing. 
  • External Factors: Changes in customer business models, economic conditions, or other external factors can impact demand and lead to leakage. 

These factors highlight the complexity of addressing contract leakage and the need for thorough analysis and collaboration between suppliers and buyers. 

Typical Remedies 

By implementing these strategies, buyers and suppliers can reduce leakage, improve contract compliance, and enhance overall performance:

  • Regular Business Reviews: Conduct regular business reviews with sales sponsors and buy-side sponsors to compare contract promises with actual performance and identify areas for improvement. 
  • Improve Data Quality: Ensure robust and accurate catalog data to enhance search results and product visibility, making it easier for users to find and order products. 
  • Adoption Monitoring: Implement a dedicated team to perform regular health checks with customers, addressing adoption issues and improving system usage. 
  • Collaborative Target Setting: Work with buyers to set collaborative spend targets and monitor progress, addressing any discrepancies proactively. 
  • Benchmarking and Analysis: Benchmark performance against other channels and systems to identify best practices and areas for improvement.  
  • Supplier lists: Sharing suppliers lists with buyers may to help buyers consolidate their spend and improve transparency. Supplier lists may helps buyers achieve better volume bundling, leverage process efficiencies, and ultimately reduce costs. Sharing these lists also facilitates better collaboration and trust with buyers. 
  • Customer Feedback: Gather anecdotal evidence and feedback from sales reps and customers to understand specific issues and develop targeted solutions. 
  • System Integration Support: Provide strong support during system integration to ensure smooth implementation and address any technical issues promptly. 
  • Educating Buyers: Informing customers about the full extent of their spend in specific categories and encouraging them to channel more of their spend through the supplier's platform. 
  • Offering Incentives: Providing incentives for buyers to reach certain volume thresholds. 
  • Blocking Non-Preferred Suppliers: Asking buyers to block certain suppliers in their system to ensure all relevant spend goes through the preferred supplier 

Conclusion

Maximizing share of wallet and minimizing contract leakage are both critical to realizing the full value of buyer–supplier relationships. While expanding market share attracts new customers, increasing wallet share and strengthening contract compliance help suppliers unlock greater revenue potential from existing partnerships. Effective contract management, robust data quality, and transparent collaboration are essential to closing the gap between expected and realized contract value.

~Julie McSwain

entry.title: Re: Combining MATID and MATNR field in CDS/AMDP
entry.content:
When joining the "MARA" table with "/SCWM/AQUA", you should link the SCWM-"MATID" with the MARA-"SCM_MATID_GUID16" ...
I believe this should not involve a conversion on your part ...

Something like below sample code should work :

define view ZTMP_TESTCDS
  as select from mara
    join /scwm/aqua on mara.scm_matid_guid16 = /scwm/aqua.matid
{
  mara.matnr       as Material,
  /scwm/aqua.matid as Material_Guid,
  mara.mtart       as MaterialType
}

Hope this helps

Nic T.

entry.title: Re: Modify a report's data source at runtime in C# from V...
entry.content:
Yes, it is possible. You would need to use the RAS object model. If you Google the topic, you should find multiple discussions and code examples.

Given that you are permanently switching to a new data connection, it makes more sense to permanently change all the reports to use the new data connection instead of repeating the process each time you run the report.

Here is a video demo of my software doing a mass-update of data source across multiple Crystal Reports.

entry.title: IPS: Global User ID
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to provision the „Global User ID“  from IAS (Source System: Local Identity Directory) into the „USER ID“ field in SAC. However, I keep getting the following error:

system=Target SAC - Source IAS

error=HTTP operation failed invoking https://iastenant.analytics.cloud.sap/api/v1/scim2/Users with statusCode: 400, Response: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"400","scimType":"mutability","detail":"Request is unparsable, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema."},

content=<hidden content> - Set property ips.trace.failed.entity.content=true to display the content of failed entities

Here is the transformation code of target System  SAC:

{

    "user": {

        "condition": "isValidEmail($.emails[0].value) && (('%sac.group.prefix%' === 'null') || ($.groups[?(@.display =~ /%sac.group.prefix%.*/)] empty false))",

        "mappings": [

            {

                "constant": [

                    "urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters",

                    "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"

                ],

                "targetPath": "$.schemas"

            },

            {

                "sourceVariable": "entityIdTargetSystem",

                "targetPath": "$.id"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.userName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.name.givenName",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.name.givenName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.name.middleName",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.name.middleName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.name.familyName",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.name.familyName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.displayName",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.displayName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.externalId",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.externalId"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.active",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.active"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.emails",

                "preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,

                "targetPath": "$.emails"

            },

            {

                "condition": "$.emails[0].length() > 0",

                "constant": true,

                "targetPath": "$.emails[0].primary"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.groups[*].value",

                "preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.groups[?(@.value)]",

                "functions": [

                    {

                        "function": "resolveEntityIds",

                        "entityType": "group"

                    }

                ]

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.emails[0].value",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']['idpUserId']"

            },

            {

                "condition": "$.emails[?(@.primary == true)].value != []",

                "sourcePath": "$.emails[?(@.primary == true)].value",

                "preserveArrayWithSingleElement": false,

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']['idpUserId']"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']['idpUserId']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']['idpUserId']"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User']['manager']['value']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User']['manager']['value']",

                "functions": [

                    {

                        "function": "resolveEntityIds"

                    }

                ]

            }

        ]

    }

}

In the code, I changed this from userName to userUuid :          

  {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.userName"

            },

Could you please help me identify what I might be doing wrong? The error suggests the request is syntactically incorrect or violates the schema, but I’m not sure what part of the payload might be causing this.

Thank you very much for your help!

Best Regards

entry.title: Principal Propagation failing between BTP Mobile Services, Cloud Connector and S/4 HANA - Access Den
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm experiencing an issue with Principal Propagation when connecting SAP Mobile Development Kit (MDK) application through BTP Mobile Services to an on-premise S/4 HANA system via Cloud Connector.

Current Setup:

  • Source: SAP Mobile Services (BTP)
  • Middleware: SAP Cloud Connector
  • Target: SAP S/4 HANA on-premise (Client 400)

Problem Description:

When I configure the connection in Mobile Services to use "Cloud Connector SSO" as the SSO mechanism and try to test it using the "Launch in Browser" button, I receive the following error:

 
Access denied to system molinos.rise:8000. In case this was a valid request, ensure to expose the system correctly in your cloud connector.

However, the same OData service works perfectly when:

  1. Accessed directly from the S/4 HANA system browser
  2. Using a BTP Destination with Basic Authentication (username/password)

But it fails when using Principal Propagation authentication method.

Current Configuration:

Cloud Connector:

  • Principal Type: X.509 Certificate
  • Resources: / exposed with "Path And All Sub-Paths"

Connection to S/4 HANA: ✅ Active

What I've Already Checked:

✅ Cloud Connector can reach S/4 HANA system (green status) ✅ OData service is active in SICF ✅ Resource "/" is exposed in Cloud Connector ✅ Virtual-to-internal host mapping is correct ✅ Basic Authentication works (confirms the OData service itself is working) ✅ Cloud Connector certificate appears to be in STRUST

Questions:

  • Is there any additional trust configuration needed between BTP, Cloud Connector, and S/4 HANA for X.509 certificate-based SSO?
  • Are there any specific authorizations my user needs in S/4 HANA to consume OData services via Principal Propagation? (Besides the standard OData consumption authorizations)

How can I verify that the Cloud Connector is correctly sending the certificate/user information to S/4 HANA?

Logs/Additional Info:

The error appears immediately when clicking "Launch in Browser" in Mobile Services. The Cloud Connector audit log shows the request is being blocked at the Cloud Connector level with the "Access denied" message.

Any guidance on the correct configuration steps or troubleshooting approach would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: HCM Brasil - Crédito do Trabalhador - Provisão para o Terceiro Mês de Férias
entry.content:
Boa tarde. Tudo bem? Já ocorreu este erro com vocês. Após a aplicação da nota para desconto em férias do empréstimos consignado.

Estou com este cenário. IT3453 com lançamento até 31.10. Férias com início em 01/11 com pagamento em 30/10. Folha de setembro finalizado. Folha de outubro será calculado após as férias. No cálculo das férias, não está sendo gerado o valor de desconto do empréstimo MCP1.

Fiz o lançamento no it3453 ref mês 11/2025 e calculei as férias e gerou o desconto. Mas utilizando o flag Provisionar a próxima parcela não funcionou.

Fiz outro teste hoje e retirei a rubrica MCP1 da tabela V_T51P6 e foi calculado a rubrica de desconto MCP1 nas férias. 

A rubrica MCP1 não deve ser cadastrado nes

entry.title: Re: BAdI to change PMP0 value of PO Item
entry.content:
Hello @KhaingZinTun,

You cannot modify PMP0 through MM_PUR_S4_PO_MODIFY_ITEM because this BAdI does not influence pricing.
If you need to set or override the Manual Gross Price (PMP0) in a purchase order, use the relevant pricing BAdIs instead.

PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT overrides the amount for a specific condition at the item level, filtering by Condition Type = 'PMP0'.

MM_PUR_S4_PO_DEFINE_CNDNCTR influences the price determination for PO items, like identifying which condition contributes.

Implement both in Custom Fields and Logic key-user extensibility. Make sure PMP0 is included in your purchasing schema and that it is allowed for manual or logic updates; otherwise, the BAdI will not work.

Useful SAP Documentation

SAP KBA 3580006 – Purchase Order Price Enhancement ,explains using PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT and MM_PUR_S4_PO_DEFINE_CNDNCTR. SAP Support Portal-3580006 - Purchase Order Price Enhancement in SAP S/HANA Cloud Public Edition

SAP KBA 2756560 – Cloud BAdIs for Pricing Lists available pricing BAdIs and usage through Custom Fields and Logic. SAP Support Portal-2756560 - Cloud BAdIs for pricing

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Creating a segregation role for reporting not working correctly
entry.content:
Hi,

We need to segregate the information in a specific RCM report, where some users in the company should only be able to view data by their Org Unit or Department (depending on their position). These same users also need access to Performance module reports.

Additionally, they can create requisitions in the RCM module, but the company’s restriction is that they can only create requisitions for positions where the field Position Vacant = Yes.

When we create the Granted and Target Groups for them in RCM, it works perfectly within RCM Reports. However, this setup impacts the Performance reports, as they can only see a limited number of employees — those whose positions have the field Position Vacant = Yes.

Is there any way to segregate all SuccessFactors data (RCM, Performance, Onboarding, Employee Central, etc.) by Org Unit or Department (depending on the position), while at the same time ensuring that these users can only create requisitions in RCM where Position Vacant = Yes?

Thanks,

Juan

entry.title: SAPUI5 Date Input and UTC Conversion
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I’m currently working as a SAPUI5 developer, and I wanted to open up a discussion (and hopefully learn from you all) about a challenge I keep running into:
DATE HANDLING in UI5/Fiori apps.
Whenever I encounter date fields — whether it's in forms, tables, filters, or while sending/receiving dates via OData — I get a bit anxious 😅. It's not like I haven't dealt with it before, but there always seems to be some unexpected issue:
  • Timezone differences
  • Formatting inconsistencies (backend vs frontend)
  • OData model quirks (Edm.Date vs Edm.DateTimeOffset)
  • Date pickers showing wrong values
  • Converting to UTC and back again

Scenario 1 - Reading Date from Date Picker ==> Whenever user selects any date from date picker, I want to get the UTC date.

For example - I am working in IST time zone and if I select the date 17-Oct-2025 in date picker and when I read it in my change event handler I get the date as 17-Oct-2025 based on local time zone. But when I tried to get the UTC date, it will be 16-Oct-2025. 

My expectation is when user selects 17-Oct-2025 irrespective of  local time zone, model property(VALID_TO) will be set to UTC date '17-08-2025T00:00:00Z'. I am doing something like this to achieve this.

Date Picker Code in UI view - 

 

<DatePicker value="{path:'localModel>VALID_TO',type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', constraints: { displayFormat: 'Date' }, formatOptions: {pattern: 'yyyy-MM-dd',  strictParsing: true, UTC: true }}" change="handleDateChange"  />
 

Date Change Event Handler - HandleDateChange in Controller

handleDateChange: function (oEvent) {
        var source = oEvent.getSource(),
          oTable = source.getParent(),          
          contextRow = oTable.getBindingContext("LocalModel").getPath() + "/VALID_TO",
          inputValue = source.getDateValue();
          //Get the Local Date Converted to UTC
          let utcDate = new Date(Date.UTC(inputValue.getFullYear(),inputValue.getMonth(),inputValue.getDate()));
          console.log(utcDate);
          this.getModel('LocalModel').setProperty(contextRow, utcDate);
      }
 This is working as expected. Your thoughts on this and if there is better way of doing it.
 
Scenario 2 - Using formatter to convert date object to UTC
Formatter Code - Check if date is defined and is a Date Object then format it as per UTC. I want to know if this is correct or there is other way of doing it. Also are there any other conditions which I should add apart from checking date instance. Or this will work in all scenarios.
Scenario 3 - Checking if input/parameter passed is Valid Date Object- Anything else we need to check or some other way of checking it.
Code - 
checkDateObject: function (date) {
      return date instanceof Date && !isNaN(date.getTime());
    }

I would like to hear your thoughts on the common date scenarios mentioned above. Additionally, please inform me whether the code provided above is useful or not.

Thanks,

Dhiraj More

entry.title: Re: Supplier Rating App in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello @Amit66 

You can use the standard Supplier Evaluation apps in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for your scenario involving delivery schedules, shortages, and product quality; there's no need for a customised app.

Core evaluation apps (Version 2)

Supplier Evaluation by Time (F1664A) , evaluates delivery schedule adherence. (Based on the delivery and Goods Receipt Date)

Supplier Evaluation by Quantity (F1661A) , measures shortages and over or under-deliveries.

 

Supplier Evaluation by Quality (F3295A) , uses quality notifications and inspection results to score product quality.

 

 

Configuration and scoring documentation

  • Supplier Evaluation Weighting and Scoring (F2551). Define and assign importance to your KPIs (Time, Quantity, Quality) for an overall supplier score..
  • Manage User Defined Criteria for Supplier (F3812), optional; allows you to add your own evaluation dimensions.
  • Operational Supplier Evaluation (F1662A), view overall scores and explore detailed results.

These Apps are in the Purchasing Analytics and Supplier Management catalogues.

More useful SAP documentation

  • SAP Help Portal – Supplier Evaluation and Scoring in Procurement
  • SAP Fiori Apps Library – Supplier Evaluation by Quantity (Version 2)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.content:
Here is the update:

The client is currently implementing the compensation tool. However, regardless of the planning method or hierarchy selected, the spreadsheets or plans will be sent to or reach all supervisors defined in the company's organizational chart, from the first level down. However, what is required is that the plans or spreadsheets only be received by the supervisors at the next level if the highest planner in the hierarchy is selected.

In this context, the indicated request can be fulfilled.

I remain attentive.

Sincerely,

entry.title: Missing Authorization S_DEVELOP when Creating Analytical List Page (S/4HANA public Cloud)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am attempting to create a report based on the documentation I found for reporting in S/4HANA Public Cloud. I am working as a Key User in the Client 100 environment, using an SAP physical inventory standard data source.

My Steps So Far:

  1. I created a Custom CDS View of the Analytical Cube type.

  2. I then created a Custom Analytical Query based on that Cube.

  3. When I try to proceed to Manage KPIs and Reports and select Create Analytical List Page, I immediately receive the following error:

    "Missing authorization S_DEVELOP"

The Problem:

My online research suggests that the S_DEVELOP error is typically related to development activities outside of the Fiori apps (such as creation via ADT/Eclipse). However:

  • I am not using Eclipse or any external development tools; I am using the standard Key User apps within the Fiori Launchpad.

  • I have been assigned all roles, including the Admin role, and development, in both environments.

  • All CDS and Query are activated and published.

Additional Information:

I also tried to find the Manage KPIs and Reports app in the Client 80 environment, but it does not appear to be available there.

Does anyone know why the S_DEVELOP authorization is being requested in the Client 100 environment when creating this object purely as a Key User without using any external development tools?

Any insight would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: No Freight unit created from Sales order in S/4 HANA...
entry.content:
Hello @S_Arora 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud TM, skip TcodeSE38: use Manage Order-Based Transportation Requirements to confirm the OTR;

If present but no FU, open the OTR and build freight units to identify the specific issue, such as no FUBR, missing TM locations, or missing material weight, volume, or UoM. Check the Application Log, Display logs for errors, correct the relevant field, then rebuild.

More useful SAP Documentation

 SAP Help  Creation and Editing of Freight Units, automatic FU creation based on FUBR and required data, and SAP KBA 2978460, Freight Unit is not generated from Sales Order, common root causes and fixes. Also SAP Learning Configuring Transportation Management

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Exchange Rate Difference Line with Zero Amount Preven...
entry.content:
Hello @kaya-ya 

Thank you for the clarification and for sharing the screenshots.

This is expected system behaviour. Although your business transactions are in TWD, the system must ensure each document is balanced across all active currencies, including the group currency (USD). When a down payment and an invoice are settled together, SAP automatically records a realised exchange rate difference if their posting or exchange-rate dates differ even slightly.

The small 0.01 USD figure you noticed is not an error; it comes from rounding and item-level currency translation rather than the down-payment scenario. This effect can also occur with partial payments, credit memos, or any multi-line clearing when exchange rates fluctuate.

You don’t need to delete this line. Instead, make sure that your exchange-rate difference accounts are correctly maintained. Define Accounts for Exchange Rate Differences and ensure that both the down payment and invoice use the appropriate rate type and posting date.

Useful SAP Documentation

  • SAP KBA 2539550; More gain/loss lines generated with amount 0.00 in LC1 or LC2 when clearing
  • SAP Help Portal; Managing Exchange Rate Differences
  • SAP Fiori App; Automatic Account Determination

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Need CDS view for customer Project Actual cost and Bi...
entry.content:
Hello @vigneshvalluvan1989 

Thank you for your feedback and follow-up. My apologies for the delay.

Use the Enterprise Projects artifacts that carry your Project ID (ProjectExternalID) and then join on the internal key:

  • Resolve your Project ID → internal key with I_EnterpriseProject fields include ProjectExternalID, ProjectUUID / Project.
  • Join that key to the data you need, such as work packages, costs, and activities via the corresponding link. CDS/API I_EnterpriseProjectElement for work packages, or module-specific released CDS). If you’re calling APIs, first hit API_ENTERPRISE_PROJECT_SRV to get the internal key by ProjectExternalID, then use it with downstream APIs.

Check: SAP KBA 3587487 (use I_EnterpriseProject / I_EnterpriseProjectElement in Public Cloud), and API Hub API_ENTERPRISE_PROJECT_SRV (query projects by external ID, retrieve UUID/key). SAP Support Portal-3587487 - Requiring CDS View for Project and WBS element for Cloud Development

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Issue While posting Idoc in SAP ECC- SAP BTP-CI
entry.content:
Hmm, "Response was of unexpected text/html ContentType." -- Can it be that CI is posting the XML IDoc with a wrong Content-Type? One tip would be to compare the iFlow in DEV-CI and in QA-CI, whether there is any difference in the settings for the HTTP POST operation, especially the HTTP Header field "Content-Type", which I think the ALE layer in the SAP system expects as "text/xml".

(Which by the way is kind of strange, because around 1998, when the SAP IDoc-XML format was defined, we introduced a special HTTP Content-Type for it: application/x-sap.idoc
The SAP Business Connector still uses application/x-sap.idoc today, when receiving and sending IDoc-XML messages, which is very convenient, because general text/xml messages are only sent through the standard XML-parser, while messages received with the special application/x-sap.idoc Content-Type are automatically converted into Java IDoc objects, which can then be processed directly in the graphical mapping tool or using the "SAP JCo IDoc Libary". But that is "off-topic"...)

Another possibility is: the SAP system sends an HTML page in case of error (for example: user and password are wrong). In that case the HTTP client (which is CI in this case) receives an HTML page ("text/html") with further error details. In that case you would only need to read that HTML page (= the body of the HTTP response) and then you know what the SAP system is complaining about...! But I don't know if and how the CI system allows to log/trace the response body of failed HTTP requests?! (In the Business Connector, there is a switch that turns on HTTP trace, logging the complete request & response (all headers and the body), which is quite nice for trouble-shooting.)

entry.title: Re: How Future-Minded HR is Shaping Mindsets to Enable Change
entry.content:
Absolutely love this post—such a powerful call to action for HR teams to lead with vision and agility. The emphasis on back-casting really resonates. It’s a brilliant way to help organizations stay competitive by aligning today’s actions with tomorrow’s needs. It also empowers HR to build the skills and resources needed to support agile transformation—not just reactively, but proactively.

I especially appreciate the focus on the outside-in perspective and the cloud mindset—both are essential for shaping future-ready cultures.

Thanks for sharing this inspiring piece!

entry.title: Re: Missing Authorization S_DEVELOP when Creating Analyti...
entry.content:
Hello @diana_gonzalezcr60 

This is not a genuine S_DEVELOP issue in Public Cloud. You are missing the the key-user analytics authorisations required to create or activate an ALP.

Do this (client 100):

Assign the following business roles to your user: SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST for creating KPIs, reports, and ALP and SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC for activating generated content). Then, log off and back on

Create the app by navigating to Custom Analytical Queries, selecting your query, then choosing Create Application, and finally selecting the Analytical List Page or using Manage KPIs Reports.

Useful SAP Documentation

  • SAP Help – Manage KPIs and the creation of reports, including KPIs/Reports/ALP, and ensure the necessary capabilities are in place. SAP Help Portal/Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition/Manage KPIs and Reports
  • SAP Help – Users and Roles (lists delivered roles incl. Analytics Specialist / SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST). SAP Help Portal/Combined Reporting for Professional Services and Sales Orders-Users and Roles

Let me know if you need further assistance

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Enable faster user changes and shared terminals using badges in SAP Digital Manufacturing

entry.title: Re: Purchase SA for Advance intercompany STO
entry.content:
Hi @Angelasapphire 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, you are right. As of the current public cloud edition, the STO process does not support purchase scheduling agreements.

What is supported as of today is the Advanced Intercompany STO, which covers Sales/Purchasing orgs in different companies with Purchase Orders but not scheduling agreements.

Although purchase scheduling agreements are available in public cloud for standard procurement, the same functionality is not yet integrated into the Advanced Intercompany STO process.

At this time SAP is yet to publish any roadmap item or feature note that confirms when or whether this integration will be delivered in future releases.

You may consider raising this on the SAP influence page if this is critical to your busines/project.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris
